intro: Habracanthus cyaneus, commonly known as the blue bellflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its stems are often hairy. The flowers bloom in the spring and are pollinated primarily by insects.
